revision.comment: new key for [[Category:Graffiti by country]]: "Hong Kong" using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{more footnotes|date=November 2014}} {{essay|date=November 2014}} }}
[[File:Wanna live here? It will be a nice price! (8225766410).jpg|thumb|Section of a mural of ''[[tong lau]]'' on [[Graham Street]] by Alex Croft]]
In [[Hong Kong]] there are a few types of graffiti that are utilized for different reasons. The face of artist [[Ai WeiWei]] is one of the more well-known caricatures in the region. Journalist and commentators have considered the graffiti as "street-art", "creative" and the "voice of the young".<ref name="Cheung2016">{{cite book|author=Charles Chi-wai Cheung|title=Media Power in Hong Kong: Hyper-Marketized Media and Cultural Resistance|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=0nSPCwAAQBAJ&pg=PT182|date=12 February 2016|publisher=Taylor & Francis|isbn=978-1-317-26657-0|pages=182–}}</ref>
Graffiti is often a mode of expression much like other artistic outlets. It can allow artists to vent emotions as well as their opinions on the politics or society around them. Unlike other places around the world, Graffiti in Hong Kong can be used as a way of advertisement for some companies.
Similar to other countries however, graffiti is considered defacing public property and is technically an illegal act in Hong Kong. While graffiti is not prosecuted as commonly as in the United States, fines and arrest still do occur.<ref name="vice_IWen">{{Cite web| title = I Went Bombing with Hong Kong's Biggest Graffiti Writers| author = Mock, Ray| work = Vice| date = 2016-07-17| accessdate = 2018-03-08| url = https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/9b8kgy/hong-kong-graffiti-tour-xme}}</ref>
==Definition of graffiti== [[Graffiti]] is a term applied to a range of illegally created marks in which there has been an attempt to establish some sort of coherent composition that people could resonate with, or one that conveys messages. Such marks are made by an individual or individuals, who might not be professional artists, upon a [[wall]] or other surface that is usually visually accessible to the public.
==Different styles of graffiti in Hong Kong==
===Calligraphy graffiti=== [[Tsang Tsou Choi]], also known as the "King of Kowloon", was the founder of [[Hong Kong]] [[calligraphy]] graffiti. His graffiti work is different from general [[spray painting]]; he used [[ink brush]]es to write [[word]]s on walls instead of spray painting to express his ideas and thoughts towards society. The [[aesthetic]] value of his works of art stirred up much controversy over Hong Kong. Still, most Hong Kong citizens still pay respect and attention to his graffiti, even though he died in 2007.<ref name="scmp_Whyg">{{Cite web| title = Why graffiti has never taken off in oh-so-law-abiding Hong Kong| author = Sin, Ben | author2 = Westcott, Ben| work = South China Morning Post| date = 2016-06-05| accessdate = 2018-03-08| url = http://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/article/1962466/why-graffiti-has-never-taken-oh-so-law-abiding-hong-kong}}</ref>
===Spray painted graffiti=== Spray painting graffiti is one of the most popular styles adopted by graffiti artists. Hong Kong graffiti artists have a unique sense on where to do graffiti to reflect different aesthetic feelings of their works. For instance, [[drawing]] on [[rust]]y surfaces like iron walls produces a vintage feeling of the work. Drawings on uneven [[stone]] walls gives a strong dimensional sense.
===Ai WeiWei's portrait=== [[Ai WeiWei]], a [[People's Republic of China|Chinese]] [[contemporary artist]] and [[activist]], was arrested by [[Beijing]] authorities for "economic crimes" . Ai's [[portrait]] was later painted on walls facing streets in Hong Kong by a teenage girl, who attempted to raise awareness of [[human rights]] and reveal the dark side of the [[Chinese government]]. Ai's portrait was even projected on Wall of the [[People's Liberation Army]] Building via [[laser]].<ref name="reut_Pro-">{{Cite web| title = Pro-Ai graffiti in Hong Kong sparks warning by Chinese army| last = Staff | first = Reuters| work = Reuters| date = 2011-04-30| accessdate = 2018-03-08| url = https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-china-grafitti-ai/pro-ai-graffiti-in-hong-kong-sparks-warning-by-chinese-army-idUSLNE74101720110502}}</ref>
==Government response== Per [[Basic Law of Hong Kong|basic law]], modifying a [[public property]] without permission is illegal in Hong Kong. On 13 July 2009, a French graffiti artist name Zevs painted a [[Chanel]] [[logo]] on the outside wall of an Armani store in central Hong Kong. He was arrested for his illicit spray-painting and was detained in Hong Kong until August. In 2011, a painted portrait of [[Ai WeiWei]] resulted in an investigation by [[Hong Kong Police Force|Hong Kong police]] and the Crime Investigate Detective. Invader, another famous graffiti artist, has been spreading his work in Hong Kong since 2001; he has painted at least 74 [[mosaic]] print tiles on city streets. Most of them have been removed. In 2014, a [[Pac-Man]] print in [[Tin Hau]] also produced by Invader was removed for safety reasons. Such actions have stirred up much disagreement. The public did not agree that tile mosaics on walls would cause any harm and danger to [[society]]. Some news articles and journals criticised the [[Government of Hong Kong|government]] for their actions towards [[street art]]. However, the government continued to take down Invader's work.
Though [[painting]] on public properties without permission is illegal, Hong Kong's government promised to preserve the painted works of King of Kowloon [[Tsang Tsou Choi]], though most have already been cleaned away. The [[wall of fame]] in [[Mong Kok]]'s [[Argyle Street, Hong Kong|Argyle Street]] provides a canvas for Hong Kong graffiti artists.<ref name="hong_Mong">{{Cite web| title = Mongkok's Graffiti Wall of Fame!| author = | work = Hong Kong Hustle| date = 3 July 2013| accessdate = 2018-03-08| url = https://www.hongkonghustle.com/art-design/7944/hong-kong-graffiti-wall-of-fame-mongkok-bute-luen-wan-street-argyle-alley-kowloon-hk-china-street-art-mk-style-artist-piece/}}</ref> The government seems to have accepted the street as a "graffiti community" even though street artists are violating the law. Paintings extend over the wall for two blocks.
==Purposes of doing graffiti in Hong Kong== Graffiti in Hong Kong can be divided into three aspects — as an [[emotion]]al outlet, for [[political dissent|political dissatisfaction]], and as [[advertisement]].
===Emotional Outletting=== Graffiti related to emotions can generally be seen in [[tunnel]]s and under bridges, where the public might not easily notice. For instance, spray painted words like "free" or "heart broken" can be seen painted on walls. The reason for such placement is to provide artists with an outlet to [[artistic expression|express]] their personal emotions. Many people express their feelings through writing and talking. However, there are people who aren't good at oral or written [[communication]]. Instead, they are more comfortable with [[drawing]] and [[art]]. Graffiti is an illegal street art, and some people are attracted to the exciting and rebellious feeling of doing illegal things in an attempt to voice their opinions.
===Political dissatisfaction=== <gallery> File:Graffiti on the road (Mong Kok, HK) (1).jpg|Graffiti on the road (Mong Kok, HK) File:Graffiti on the road (Mong Kok, HK) (2).jpg|Graffiti on the road (Mong Kok, HK) </gallery>
Graffiti can also be used to voice [[opinion]]s and dissatisfaction towards [[government authority|authorities]]. For instance, there was graffiti related to "real [[universal suffrage]]" being drawn in [[Admiralty (HK)|Admiralty]] during [[2014 Hong Kong protests|the Occupy Central protests in 2014]]. Individuals voiced their [[anger]] and depression towards both the Chinese and Hong Kong governments through graffiti work. They hoped to make common cause with Hong Kong [[citizen]]s through graffiti art in order to gain more support for universal suffrage. For example, protesters not only did chalk paint graffiti, but also created a [[mural]] made from thousands of [[Post-it note|Post-It notes]] with citizens' wishes written on each. Couplets with citizens' petitions were also hung on a [[footbridge]].
===Advertisement=== Graffiti can also be used cheaply as a medium to advertise in Hong Kong. It is quite common to see advertisements spray-painted on [[public buildings|public facilities]], [[letter box|mailslots]], [[transformer]] boxes, [[street sign]]s, and so on. Company names and contact data might be written or drawn in an attempt for publication purposes. Such graffiti can be commonly seen in traditional [[Districts of Hong Kong|districts]] such as [[Sham Shui Po]] and [[Kwun Tong]]. It is a style of graffiti unique to Hong Kong.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://graffiti.org/faq/graf.def.html Graffiti.org] *[http://artradarjournal.com/2009/07/29/street-artist-zevs-detained-in-hong-kong-for-defacing-chanel-logo-interview/ Artradarjournal.com] *[http://www.stylebyasia.com/invasion-of-hong-kong-french-graffiti-mosaic-artist-leaves-his-mark-photo-feast/ Stylebyasia.com] *[http://www.hongkonghustle.com/art-design/7944/hong-kong-graffiti-wall-of-fame-mongkok-bute-luen-wan-street-argyle-alley-kowloon-hk-china-street-art-mk-style-artist-piece/ Hongkonghustle.com] *[http://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/arts-culture/article/1436313/street-artist-invader-responds-after-his-art-wiped-hong-kongs Scmp.com] *[http://tvb4life.pixnet.net/blog/post/176703678-%E7%8E%A9%E7%89%A9%E5%A3%AF%E5%BF%97-%E8%A1%97%E4%B8%8A%E7%95%AB-%E5%A1%97%E9%B4%89--graffiti Tvb4life.pixnet.net]
{{Hong Kong topics}}

revision.comment: /* 2000s */Added unproduced Death: The High Cost of Living film.
revision.text:
The following is '''a list of unproduced Guillermo del Toro projects''' in roughly chronological order. During his decades-long career, Mexican film director [[Guillermo del Toro]] has worked on a number of projects that never progressed beyond the pre-production stage. Some of these projects fell into [[development hell]] and are presumably canceled. ==1990s== ===''The Sandkings''=== Around 1995, before directing ''[[Mimic (film)|Mimic]]'', del Toro approached [[George R. R. Martin]] with the intent to make a film adaptation of his famous novelette ''[[Sandkings (novelette)|Sandkings]]'',{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/guillermo-del-toro-breaking-bad-game-of-thrones-interview/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-20 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161121042914/http://collider.com/guillermo-del-toro-breaking-bad-game-of-thrones-interview/ |archivedate=2016-11-21 }} but the project was quickly scrapped after the novel was adapted into the first episode of the television series ''[[The Outer Limits (1995 TV series)|The Outer Limits]]''. ===''Domu: A Child's Dream''=== In the late 1990s, del Toro expressed interest in directing a [[Domu: A Child's Dream#Film adaptation|live-action film adaptation]] of [[Katsuhiro Otomo]]'s ''[[Domu: A Child's Dream]]''. In 2002, after the success of ''[[Blade II]]'', del Toro said that he tried to make the film in the following years, but his efforts were hamstrung by international legalities.
"Goddamn it, we haven't even got the rights. We've been negotiating the rights for four years, which goes to prove Japanese lawyers are even more complex than American lawyers. The moment we have the rights I would go ahead and write it." {{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2002-03-27/guillermo-del-toro-on-domu |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220150426/http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2002-03-27/guillermo-del-toro-on-domu |archivedate=2016-12-20 }}
==2000s== ===''Blade 3''=== In approximately 2003, [[New Line Cinema]] was in talks with del Toro to keep him on as director for ''Blade 3'', due his directing work on ''[[Blade II]]. However, D''el Toro turned down the offer in order to direct ''[[Hellboy (2004 film)|Hellboy]]''.{{cite web|url=http://uproxx.com/hitfix/david-goyer-directing-blade-3-was-the-most-painful-thing-ive-ever-been-through/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119182045/http://uproxx.com/hitfix/david-goyer-directing-blade-3-was-the-most-painful-thing-ive-ever-been-through/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} ''Blade 3'' film ended up becoming the critically snubbed ''[[Blade: Trinity]]'', directed by screenwriter [[David S. Goyer]], and released in 2004. ===''The Wind in the Willows''=== In 2003, del Toro reported that he was working with [[The Walt Disney Company]] on an [[The Wind in the Willows#Film and television|animated film adaptation]] of [[Kenneth Grahame]]'s novel ''[[The Wind in the Willows]]''. The film would have been animated using [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI animation]], but the project was abandoned following many delays.http://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/more-related-content/?relatedmovieid=15120/ {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119120309/http://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/more-related-content/?relatedmovieid=15120%2F |date=2016-11-19 }} ===''Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban''=== In 2003, del Toro was in talks to direct ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]'', the third installment of the [[Harry Potter (film series)|''Harry Potter'' film series]] based on [[J. K. Rowlings]]' [[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban|novel of the same name]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2429331/guillermo-game-for-harry-potter/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119031251/http://www.mtv.com/news/2429331/guillermo-game-for-harry-potter/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} However, he chose instead to direct ''[[Hellboy (2004 film)|Hellboy]]'', and ''The Prisoner of Azkaban'' was directed by [[Alfonso Cuarón]]. ===''I Am Legend''=== On September 13, 2005, [[Warner Bros.]] approached del Toro and asked him to direct the third film adaptation of [[Richard Matheson]]'s novel ''[[I Am Legend (novel)|I Am Legend]]''.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2005/film/features/helmer-takes-on-legend-for-wb-1117929062/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161120084856/http://variety.com/2005/film/features/helmer-takes-on-legend-for-wb-1117929062/ |archivedate=2016-11-20 }} However, del Toro chose to direct ''[[Hellboy II: The Golden Army]]'' instead. ''I Am Legend'' was finally released in 2007, directed by [[Francis Lawrence]]. ===''Tarzan''=== On December 15, 2006, [[ComingSoon.net]] reported that del Toro was in talks to direct a ''Tarzan'' film.{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/513701-del_toro_directing_tarzan |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119120615/http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/513701-del_toro_directing_tarzan |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} Then, in September 2008, [[/Film|Slashfilm.com]] reported that [[Stephen Sommers]] had replaced del Toro as director.{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/stephen-sommers-replaces-guillermo-del-toro-on-tarzan/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119181837/http://www.slashfilm.com/stephen-sommers-replaces-guillermo-del-toro-on-tarzan/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} The film, finally released in 2016 under the title ''[[The Legend of Tarzan (film)|The Legend of Tarzan]],'' was actually directed by [[David Yates]].{{cite web|url=http://www.vulture.com/2012/11/david-yates-committing-to-tarzan-at-warner-bros.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-03-09 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140411002805/http://www.vulture.com/2012/11/david-yates-committing-to-tarzan-at-warner-bros.html |archivedate=2014-04-11 }} ===''The Orphanage'' remake=== In 2007, [[New Line Cinema]] bought the rights to produce an English-language [[The Orphanage (film)#Remake|remake]] with del Toro as producer.{{cite news |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117971541.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 |title=New Line mulls 'Orphanage' remake |accessdate=2008-10-28 |work=Variety|date=7 September 2007 | first1=Emiliano | last1=De Pablos}}{{cite news |url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/451232/The-Orphanage-Remake-/details |title=The Orphanage (Remake) |accessdate=2008-10-28 |work=The New York Times}} On remakes, the original's director [[J. A. Bayona]] noted that "The Americans have all the money in the world but can't do anything, while we can do whatever we want but don't have the money" and "The American industry doesn't take chances, that's why they make remakes of movies that were already big hits".{{cite web |url=http://sitgesfilmfestival.com/eng/noticies/?id=1002893 |title="J.A. Bayona: "The important things are emotions, not awards"" |accessdate=2008-10-27 |publisher=[[Sitges Film Festival]] |date=9 October 2008 }} On August 4, 2009, [[Larry Fessenden]] was announced as the director of the American remake.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/film/news/e3if7a4852b0435babdb7b3ce2f7bf972ed|title='Orphanage' remake finds a director|author1=Kit, Borys |author2=Zeitchik, Steven |work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=August 4, 2009|accessdate=August 13, 2009}} Fessenden later announced that he would not be involved with directing the remake, stating "Working on the script with Guillermo was a very exciting experience, but then I got into a casting miasma and that's where the thing is; I think they're gonna do it another way, actually. So I think I'm out of it. Hopefully they'll still use my script, but I'm not sure I'm directing it anymore".{{cite web |url=http://www.joblo.com/arrow/index.php?id=19405 |title=Excl: Orphanage director out |accessdate=November 25, 2009 |work=Arrow in the Head|date=November 19, 2009}} In January 2010, [[Mark Pellington]] replaced Larry Fessenden as director of the project.{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118013246.html?categoryid=13&cs=1&query=The+Orphanage|work=Variety|author=McNary, Dave|date=January 2, 2010|accessdate=January 12, 2010|title='Orphanage' finds helmer}} On August 5, 2011, Guillermo del Toro stated that the remake would reflect his original vision for the film, and that it had been planned even when the first version was in production. "Even when we produced [[The Orphanage (film)|the Spanish movie]], I had intended to remake it because we had a very different screenplay that, because of money and time, got turned into the movie you saw – which is great, but there was this other structure for the original script that I wanted to try. So even before we shot the first film it was an economic decision, a pre-existing creative decision, to change it." Del Toro also praised the new film's director. "We have Mark Pellington attached as director – I'm a big fan of his ''[[The Mothman Prophecies]]'' and his video work – and we are out to actors, so we're hoping to get things going soon."{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.ie/movies/news/a333542/guillermo-del-toro-orphanage-remake-will-be-different.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|author=Uddin, Zakia|date=August 5, 2011|accessdate=February 27, 2012|title=Guillermo del Toro: 'Orphanage remake will be different'}} On August 30, 2011, it was reported that American actress [[Amy Adams]] was in talks to star as Laura, the main character, who was played by Belén Rueda in the original film. It was also stated that the current incarnation of the remake screenplay had been written by Larry Fessenden and [[Sergio G. Sánchez]], the sole writer of the original film.{{cite news|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/26100|work=[[Bloody Disgusting]]|last=Miska|first=Brad|date=August 30, 2011|accessdate=February 27, 2012|title=BD Horror news – 3-Time Academy Award Nominee Amy Adams Checking Into 'The Orphanage'?}} Since then, there has been no further development news, leading to a possible cancelation. === ''3993'' === On November 8, 2007, [[ComingSoon.net]] reported that del Toro was working on a [[spiritual sequel]] to ''[[Pan's Labyrinth]]'', titled ''[[Pan's Labyrinth#Sequel|3993]]'' and intended to be the third and final installment of a [[Spanish Civil War]] film trilogy.{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/horror/news/708222-guillermo-del-toros-3993-details |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119120752/http://www.comingsoon.net/horror/news/708222-guillermo-del-toros-3993-details |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} However, del Toro scrapped the project after deciding to direct ''[[Hellboy II: The Golden Army]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.cbr.com/pans-labyrinth-things-you-never-knew/ |title=Pan’s Labyrinth: 15 Things You Never Knew |accessdate=2018-11-06 |deadurl=no }} ===''Death: The High Cost of Living''=== In 2008, a film based on ''[[Death: The High Cost of Living]]'', to be called ''Death and Me'', was under production at [[New Line Cinema]]. [[Neil Gaiman]] wrote the screenplay, and would also direct, with del Toro as [[executive producer]]. Gaiman spent several days on the set of del Toro's film ''[[Hellboy II: The Golden Army]]'' to get pointers on how to direct.[http://www.scifi.com/scifiwire/index.php?category=0&id=45051 Del Toro Wants Gaiman On ''Death''] On October 14, 2010 it was reported in an interview with Gaiman that as of June or July, DC and Warner Bros. had closed down work on the film and it was unclear if they would start it up again.[http://nymag.com/daily/entertainment/2010/10/the_vulture_transcript_neil_ga.html The Vulture Transcript: Neil Gaiman on Comics, Twilight, Twitter Etiquette, Killing Batman, and Sharing Porn With His Son] ===''Thor''=== Around 2008, del Toro was being considered to direct a ''[[Thor (film)|Thor]]'' film for [[Marvel Studios]].{{cite web|url=http://www.reelz.com/movie-news/11437/guillermo-del-toro-sets-the-record-straight-on-his-involvement-with-thor-and-dr-strange-and-updates-the-hulk-tv-series/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111213030848/http://www.reelz.com/movie-news/11437/guillermo-del-toro-sets-the-record-straight-on-his-involvement-with-thor-and-dr-strange-and-updates-the-hulk-tv-series/ |archivedate=2011-12-13 }} Because of his admiration of [[Jack Kirby]]'s work, del Toro entered into negotiations to direct the film. He said that he loved the character of [[Loki (comics)|Loki]], and wished to incorporate more original [[Norse mythology]] into the film; including a "really dingy [[Valhalla]], [with] [[Vikings]] and mud".{{cite web|url=http://www.blastr.com/2012/08/guillermo_del_toro_reveal.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-02-26 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170227234716/http://www.blastr.com/2012/08/guillermo_del_toro_reveal.php |archivedate=2017-02-27 }} However, del Toro left the project to direct [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' film adaptation.]] ''Thor'' was released in 2011 and directed by [[Kenneth Branagh]]. ===''Halo''=== On February 8, 2008, it was reported that del Toro was in talks to direct a film adaptation of the [[Halo (series)|''Halo'' video game series]].https://web.archive.org/web/20111107052950/http://www.empireonline.com/interviews/Interview.asp?IID=740 However, he chose instead to focus on [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' film adaptation]]. ===''The Hobbit''=== In April 2008, it was reported that del Toro would direct a two-part film adaptation of [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s fantasy novel ''[[The Hobbit]]''. Del Toro envisioned the first film as a direct adaptation of the novel, with the second bridging the gap between ''The Hobbit'' and the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|Lord of the Rings]]'' films. After spending two years in New Zealand working on pre-production, del Toro left the project due to ongoing delays and was replaced by ''Lord of the Rings'' director [[Peter Jackson]]. The films were expanded to a trilogy during production, and were released as ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey|An Unexpected Journey]]'' (2012), ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug|The Desolation of Smaug]]'' (2013), and ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies|The Battle of the Five Armies]]'' (2014), with del Toro still credited as co-writer of all three.https://web.archive.org/web/20080730161821/http://www.wetanz.com/holics/index.php?itemid=695&catid=2{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/horror |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119142503/http://www.comingsoon.net/horror |archivedate=2016-11-19 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/66472-guillermo-del-toro-confirms-hobbit-delay |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160923203942/http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/66472-guillermo-del-toro-confirms-hobbit-delay |archivedate=2016-09-23 }} ===''Hater''=== On May 20, 2008, del Toro revealed that he was set to produce the film adaptation of ''Hater'' by [[David Moody]].{{cite news|last=Fleming|first=Michael|title=Universal, del Toro love 'Hater'|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117986200|accessdate=August 8, 2012|newspaper=Variety|date=May 20, 2008}} However, he has provided no updates after this announcement, suggesting the project's cancellation. ===''Hellboy III''=== On July 10, 2008, del Toro expressed his interest in directing a third ''[[Hellboy]]'' film, saying that he would work on the film after finishing ''[[The Hobbit (film series)|The Hobbit]]''.http://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/more-related-content/?relatedmovieid=771034116/ {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119120405/http://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/more-related-content/?relatedmovieid=771034116%2F |date=2016-11-19 }} In 2010, during the production of the unmade ''At the Mountain of Madness'', del Toro mentioned that he would direct ''Hellboy III'' after his next project, even though the script was not yet written.http://collider.com/2010/06/25/guillermo-del-toro-interview-the-hobbit-hellboy-3-frankenstein-at-the-mountains-of-madness-saturn-and-the-end-of-days/#more-34233 {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101206020646/http://www.collider.com/2010/06/25/guillermo-del-toro-interview-the-hobbit-hellboy-3-frankenstein-at-the-mountains-of-madness-saturn-and-the-end-of-days/ |date=2010-12-06 }} However, on July 8, 2013, del Toro said that the film was unlikely to be released, and suggested the possibility of telling its story in comic book form. ''[[Hellboy]]'' creator [[Mike Mignola]] refused to accept the idea.{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/hellboy-3-news-guillermo-del-toro/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-07-08 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130710225239/http://collider.com/hellboy-3-news-guillermo-del-toro/ |archivedate=2013-07-10 }} In a [[Reddit]] AMA on July 11, 2014, del Toro said:
Well, you know, we don't have that movie on the horizon, but the idea for it was to have Hellboy finally come to terms with the fact that his destiny, his inevitable destiny, is to become the beast of the Apocalypse, and having him and Liz face the sort of, that part of his nature, and he has to do it, in order to be able to ironically vanquish the foe that he has to face in the 3rd film. He has to become the beast of the Apocalypse to be able to defend humanity, but at the same time, he becomes a much darker being. It's a very interesting ending to the series, but I don't think it will happen. ... We have gone through basically every studio and asked for financing, and they are not interested. I think that the first movie made its budget back, and a little bit of profit, but then it was very very big on video and DVD. The story repeated itself with the second already, it made its money back at the box office, but a small margin of profit in the release of the theatrical print, but was very very big on DVD and video. Sadly now from a business point of view all the studios know is that you don't have that safety net of the DVD and video, so they view the project as dangerous."{{cite web|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/2agklw/i_am_guillermo_del_toro_director_writer_producer/ciuvi56/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150525050751/http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/2agklw/i_am_guillermo_del_toro_director_writer_producer/ciuvi56 |archivedate=2015-05-25 }}
On September 26, 2016, [[Ron Perlman]] stated on [[Twitter]] that he was working on a new ''[[Hellboy]]'' film, but that del Toro was unlikely to return.{{cite web|url=http://www.screengeek.net/2016/09/25/ron-perlman-confirms-hes-working-on-hellboy-3/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-01-17 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161212175358/http://www.screengeek.net/2016/09/25/ron-perlman-confirms-hes-working-on-hellboy-3/ |archivedate=2016-12-12 }} On February 21, 2017, del Toro announced on Twitter that the third ''Hellboy'' movie had been scrapped.{{cite web|url=http://movieweb.com/hellboy-3-officially-not-happening-guillermo-del-toro/ |title=Hellboy 3 Will Never Happen Confirms Guillermo Del Toro |first=Ryan |last=Scott |work=MovieWeb |date=February 21, 2017 |accessdate=February 23, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170222151112/http://movieweb.com/hellboy-3-officially-not-happening-guillermo-del-toro/ |archivedate=February 22, 2017 }} A [[Hellboy (2019 film)|reboot]] will be released in 2019 with no involvent from Del Toro. ===''The Witches''=== On December 1, 2008, del Toro expressed interest in making a [[stop-motion]] film remake of [[Roald Dahl]]'s novel ''[[The Witches (novel)|The Witches]]'' with fellow director [[Alfonso Cuarón]].{{cite web|url=http://io9.gizmodo.com/5100620/guillermo-del-toro-dances-with-roald-dahls-witches |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-01-24 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160508092144/http://io9.gizmodo.com/5100620/guillermo-del-toro-dances-with-roald-dahls-witches |archivedate=2016-05-08 }} However, there have been no updates on the project since 2008, and it seems the production has been cancelled. ==2010s== ===''Drood''=== On June 1, 2010, [[MTV News]] reported that del Toro was set to direct a film adaptation of ''[[Drood (novel)|Drood]],'' a novel by [[Dan Simmons]], for [[Universal Pictures]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2436584/guillermo-del-toro-leaves-the-hobbit-so-whats-next-for-the-director/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119181927/http://www.mtv.com/news/2436584/guillermo-del-toro-leaves-the-hobbit-so-whats-next-for-the-director/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} However, the project fell into [[development hell]] and del Toro abandoned it. ===Untitled [[Van Helsing]] project=== On June 10, 2010, del Toro stated that he was working on an untitled film about [[Van Helsing]],{{cite web|url=https://thefilmstage.com/2010/06/10/guillermo-del-toro-writingproducing-new-van-helsing-film/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716233857/http://thefilmstage.com/2010/06/10/guillermo-del-toro-writingproducing-new-van-helsing-film/ |archivedate=2011-07-16 }} but there have been no updates on the film since 2010. ===''At the Mountains of Madness''=== On July 28, 2010, del Toro announced that he would direct a film adaptation of [[H. P. Lovecraft]]'s ''[[At the Mountains of Madness]]'' for [[Universal Pictures]], with Canadian film director [[James Cameron]] as producer. The movie was originally set up as a [[DreamWorks]] project in 2004, but was later cancelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.thewrap.com/movies/column-post/cameron-produce-del-toros-madness-universal-19671 |title=Cameron to Produce Del Toro's 'Madness' for Universal |work=TheWrap |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100801174443/http://www.thewrap.com/movies/column-post/cameron-produce-del-toros-madness-universal-19671 |archivedate=2010-08-01 }} Cameron suggested casting [[Tom Cruise]] in the lead role and releasing the film in [[3D film|3-D]].{{cite web|url=http://www.filmcomment.com/article/unproduced-and-unfinished-films-a-ongoing-film-comment-project/|title=Unproduced and Unfinished Films: An Ongoing Film Comment project - Film Comment|publisher=}} In June 2010, del Toro said that the adaptation probably would not happen at all. He stated, "It doesn't look like I can do it. It's very difficult for the studios to take the step of doing a period-set, R-rated, tentpole movie with a tough ending and no love story. Lovecraft has a readership as big as any best-seller, but it's tough to quantify because his works are in the public domain."{{Cite web|url=http://www.empireonline.com/movies/news/next-guillermo-del-toro/|title=What Next For Guillermo Del Toro?|last=Williams|first=Owen|website=Empire|language=en|access-date=2017-03-26}} Cameron and Del Toro put forward the idea to Universal, who greenlit it.{{cite web|url=http://www.collider.com/2010/08/07/james-cameron-avatar-re-release-sequel-novel-titanic-3d-at-the-mountains-of-madness-guillermo-del-toro/ |title=James Cameron Talks 9 Minutes of AVATAR Re-Release Footage, Shooting the Sequels Back to Back, 3D Conversions, and AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS |work=Collider |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100814124924/http://www.collider.com/2010/08/07/james-cameron-avatar-re-release-sequel-novel-titanic-3d-at-the-mountains-of-madness-guillermo-del-toro |archivedate=2010-08-14 }} Earlier that same year, del Toro had also asked [[S. T. Joshi]] if he wanted to be a consultant once the movie got into production.{{cite web|url=http://stjoshi.org/news.html |title=S. T. Joshi - Blog |work=stjoshi.org |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312123740/http://stjoshi.org/news.html |archivedate=2012-03-12 }} However, due to many delays, Cameron and del Toro left the project after del Toro realized that the film would have been very similar to [[Ridley Scott]]'s 2012 film ''[[Prometheus (2012 film)|Prometheus]]''. ===''The Haunted Mansion'' remake=== It was announced on July 22, 2010 at [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] that a new film based on Disney's ''The Haunted Mansion'' was in development with [[Guillermo del Toro]] writing and producing. Del Toro saw the 2003 film with his daughters; when asked about his involvement in the new project, he said, "The thing I want to do is remake it."{{cite web | url = http://www.collider.com/2010/07/27/sdcc2010-guillermo-del-toro-interview-dont-be-afraid-of-the-dark-the-haunted-mansion-frankenstein-hellboy/ | title = SDCC2010: Guillermo del Toro Interview DON’T BE AFRAID OF THE DARK; Plus Info on THE HAUNTED MANSION, FRANKENSTEIN and HELLBOY | accessdate = July 29, 2010 | last = Radish | first = Christina | date = July 27, 2010 | publisher = Collider}} Elaborating, he commented, "The movie I see in my head of ''Haunted Mansion'' is not, I believe, what everyone is imagining it to be. It's not just a regular world with a haunted mansion plopped in the middle. I really am thinking of a movie that has a heightened reality."{{cite web | url = http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1644374/20100724/story.jhtml | title = Guillermo Del Toro Dishes On 'Haunted Mansion' Remake | accessdate = July 25, 2010 | last = Schwartz | first = Terri | date = July 24, 2010 | publisher = MTV}} Del Toro said that [[Hatbox Ghost]] would be the main haunting and added, "We are not making it a comedy. We are making it scary and fun at the same time, but the scary will be scary." It is to be filmed in live-action 3D.{{cite web | url = http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1644283/20100722/story.jhtml | title = 'Tron Legacy' Stars Get Comic-Con Crowd Involved In The Movie | accessdate = July 25, 2010 | last = Warmoth | first = Brian | date = July 22, 2010 | publisher = MTV}} To help make a respectful adaptation, del Toro has contacted [[Walt Disney World]] Imagineer Jason Surrell, author of ''The Haunted Mansion: From the Magic Kingdom to the Movies'', to act as a possible consultant for the film.{{cite web|url=http://knowtheartist.com/author-jason-surrell-assembles-art-of-marvels-the-avengers/ |title=Jason Surrell assembles ''The Art of Marvel's The Avengers'' |accessdate=June 21, 2012 |last=Armstrong |first=Josh |date=May 14, 2012 |publisher=KnowTheArtist.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120521011917/http://knowtheartist.com/author-jason-surrell-assembles-art-of-marvels-the-avengers/ |archivedate=May 21, 2012 }} Del Toro has also announced he is aiming for a PG-13 rating for ''[[The Haunted Mansion (film)#Remake|The Haunted Mansion]]''.{{cite web | url = http://www.darkhorizons.com/news/18253 | title = Del Toro Talks "Mansion" & "Madness"}} On August 7, 2012, Del Toro mentioned in an interview with [[Collider (website)|Collider]] that he had submitted his final draft to Disney, and that "they like the screenplay" because "their reaction to the draft was good".{{cite web | url = http://collider.com/guillermo-del-toro-haunted-mansion-harry-potter-interview/187252/ | title = Guillermo del Toro Talks HAUNTED MANSION and His Love of HARRY POTTER}} Del Toro revealed that he will co-write the film, but will not direct it.[http://collider.com/justice-league-dark-news-haunted-mansion-news-guillermo-del-toro/ Guillermo del Toro Gives Updates on JUSTICE LEAGUE DARK and HAUNTED MANSION; Confirms He Won’t Direct HAUNTED MANSION] On April 9, 2015, Variety reported that [[Ryan Gosling]] is in talks to star in the film and D.V. DeVincentis will work on the film's script.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/ryan-gosling-to-star-in-guillermo-del-toros-haunted-mansion-1201469772/|title=Ryan Gosling to Star in Guillermo del Toro's 'Haunted Mansion'|publisher=Variety|last=McNary|first=Dave|date=April 9, 2015}} ===''Insane''=== On December 11, 2010, at the [[Spike Video Game Awards]], del Toro reported that he was working on a video game entitled ''[[Insane (cancelled video game)|Insane]]'', planned for release in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/31997/Volition_Del_Toro_Confirm_Partnership_On_inSane_For_2013.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119122226/http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/31997/Volition_Del_Toro_Confirm_Partnership_On_inSane_For_2013.php |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} Two days later, he revealed that the game was to be the first entry of an ''Insane'' video game trilogy.http://investor.thq.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=96376&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=1506774&highlight= On March 11, 2011, [http://www.fanboy-confidential.com/ Fanboy Confidential] reported that [[Guy Davis (comics)|Guy Davis]], who previously worked on del Toro's unmade adaptation of ''[[At the Mountains of Madness]]'', was working as key designer.{{cite web|url=http://www.fanboy-confidential.com/articles/news-guy-davis-working-on-insane/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-03-18 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120307073911/http://www.fanboy-confidential.com/articles/news-guy-davis-working-on-insane/ |archivedate=2012-03-07 }} However, on August 16, 2012, IGN reported that the video game was cancelled by the publisher [[THQ]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/08/06/thq-drops-guillermo-del-toros-insane |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120808192903/http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/08/06/thq-drops-guillermo-del-toros-insane |archivedate=2012-08-08 }} Despite this, three months later del Toro stated that the game could still happen.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/11/20/guillermo-del-toro-on-gaming-and-the-halo-movie |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-01-15 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130118204654/http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/11/20/guillermo-del-toro-on-gaming-and-the-halo-movie |archivedate=2013-01-18 }} ===''Beauty and the Beast''=== On July 18, 2011, TheFilmStage reported that del Toro was developing a live-action film of the classic [[fairy tale]] and Disney film ''[[Beauty and the Beast]]'', with [[Emma Watson]] to star as Belle and [[Denise Di Novi]] to co-produce.{{cite web|url=https://thefilmstage.com/news/guillermo-del-toro-developing-beauty-and-the-beast-for-emma-watson-while-potter-producer-finds-new-project/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119182535/https://thefilmstage.com/news/guillermo-del-toro-developing-beauty-and-the-beast-for-emma-watson-while-potter-producer-finds-new-project/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} However, del Toro's adaptation never materialized, though Watson did play the role of Belle in [[The Walt Disney Company]]'s [[Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)|2017 live-action remake]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/emma-watson-cast-disneys-live-767095 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-01-30 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170103025144/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/emma-watson-cast-disneys-live-767095 |archivedate=2017-01-03 }} ===''Godzilla''=== On December 21, 2011, [[ComingSoon.net]] stated that del Toro was being considered, but refused, to direct a new ''[[Godzilla]].''{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/horror |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119142503/http://www.comingsoon.net/horror |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} The film was finally released in 2014, directed by [[Gareth Edwards (director)|Gareth Edwards]]. ===''The Bloody Benders''=== On April 27, 2012, ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' reported that del Toro was working on a [[biopic]] about serial killers The [[Bloody Benders]].{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2012/04/guillermo-del-toro-teams-with-angry-films-on-the-bloody-benders-spec-263155/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119182023/http://deadline.com/2012/04/guillermo-del-toro-teams-with-angry-films-on-the-bloody-benders-spec-263155/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} However, the project was likely abandoned due to del Toro's commitment to other projects. ===''The Hulk''=== Around 2012, del Toro was in talks with [[Marvel Studios]] to make a TV series titled ''The Hulk'' as part of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]]. The series was intended to be aired on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]. However, after [[Mark Ruffalo]]'s acclaimed performance as [[Hulk (comics)|the Incredible Hulk]] in ''[[The Avengers (2012 film)|The Avengers]]'', the project was put on hold,{{cite web|url=http://screencrush.com/guillermo-del-toro-incredible-hulk-tv-series-marvel/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119120344/http://screencrush.com/guillermo-del-toro-incredible-hulk-tv-series-marvel/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} and entered development hell. ===''The Wolverine''=== Around 2012, del Toro entered negotiations with [[20th Century Fox]] to direct ''[[The Wolverine (film)|The Wolverine]]''. He met with producer [[Jim Gianopulos]] and actor [[Hugh Jackman]] to talk about the film's development.{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/guillermo-del-toro-hulk-the-wolverine-interview/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-08-07 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130413053308/http://collider.com/guillermo-del-toro-hulk-the-wolverine-interview/ |archivedate=2013-04-13 }} However, del Toro left the project to direct ''[[Pacific Rim (film)|Pacific Rim]]''. The film was finally released in 2013, directed by [[James Mangold]]. ===''Dark Universe''=== On January 15, 2013, del Toro confirmed his involvement in a live-action film adaptation of the ''[[Justice League Dark]]'' comic series.{{cite web|url=http://www.sohood.com/movie-guillermo-del-toro-confirms-dc-dark-universe-movie/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160221152500/http://www.sohood.com/movie-guillermo-del-toro-confirms-dc-dark-universe-movie/ |archivedate=2016-02-21 }} While [[Warner Bros.]] was considering greenlighting the film's production, and reviewing the script, del Toro revealed that the working title was ''Dark Universe'' and that the film would feature appearances by [[John Constantine]], [[Swamp Thing]], [[Spectre (DC Comics character)|The Spectre]], [[Deadman (DC Comics)|Deadman]] and others.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/markhughes/2014/11/25/exclusive-justice-league-dark-script-in-studio-hands-today/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-11-25 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141125233352/http://www.forbes.com/sites/markhughes/2014/11/25/exclusive-justice-league-dark-script-in-studio-hands-today/ |archivedate=2014-11-25 }} Del Toro later expressed interest in casting [[Matt Ryan (actor)|Matt Ryan]] as [[John Constantine]], saying that the ''[[Constantine (TV series)|Constantine]]'' TV series could coexist with the [[DC Extended Universe]], because he felt that it could work well,{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/10/15/guillermo-del-toro-says-justice-league-dark-and-the-john-constantine-tv-show-can-coexist |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-15 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015144545/http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/10/15/guillermo-del-toro-says-justice-league-dark-and-the-john-constantine-tv-show-can-coexist |archivedate=2013-10-15 }} but when the series was not renewed for a second season due to poor ratings, del Toro scrapped the idea.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2015/06/07/constantine-cancelled-no-season-2-on-other-network/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119182236/http://tvline.com/2015/06/07/constantine-cancelled-no-season-2-on-other-network/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} In December 2014, one month after Warner Bros. reviewed his script, del Toro confirmed that the film would be part of the [[DC Extended Universe]].{{cite web|url=http://screenrant.com/justice-league-dark-movie-dc-shared-universe/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-01-14 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906022604/http://screenrant.com/justice-league-dark-movie-dc-shared-universe/ |archivedate=2015-09-06 }} In October 2015, it was officially reported that del Toro had left the project.{{cite web|url=http://www.empireonline.com/people/guillermo-del-toro/guillermo-del-toro-reportedly-departs-dc-dark-universe/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161119115948/http://www.empireonline.com/people/guillermo-del-toro/guillermo-del-toro-reportedly-departs-dc-dark-universe/ |archivedate=2016-11-19 }} ===''Silent Hills ''=== On August 12, 2014, Hero complex reported that del Toro was working with game director [[Hideo Kojima]] on the [[PlayStation 4]] video game ''[[Silent Hills]]'', the ninth installment in the [[Silent Hill|''Silent Hill'' video game series]].http://herocomplex.latimes.com/games/guillermo-del-toro-hideo-kojima-team-up-for-new-silent-hill-game/#/0 {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140813075202/http://herocomplex.latimes.com/games/guillermo-del-toro-hideo-kojima-team-up-for-new-silent-hill-game/ |date=2014-08-13 }} However, on April 26, 2015, del Toro stated via IGN that he was no longer working with Kojima on ''Silent Hills'' and that the project had been cancelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/04/26/guillermo-del-toro-touches-on-his-collaboration-with-kojima |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-11-19 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170226215206/http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/04/26/guillermo-del-toro-touches-on-his-collaboration-with-kojima |archivedate=2017-02-26 }}{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/its-official-silent-hills-is-cancelled-1700379816 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-04-27 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150427190334/http://kotaku.com/its-official-silent-hills-is-cancelled-1700379816 |archivedate=2015-04-27 }} Then, on July 24, del Toro stated via his [[Twitter]] account that he and Kojima were still working on a new untitled project.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/07/24/silent-hills-kojima-del-toro-still-plan-to-work-on-new-project |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-07-25 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150727001523/http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/07/24/silent-hills-kojima-del-toro-still-plan-to-work-on-new-project |archivedate=2015-07-27 }} In an interview with [[Shacknews]], del Toro said that he would never again get involved in video games after his past experiences.
I have proven to be the albatross of video games. I joined [[THQ]], and THQ goes broke. I join [[Hideo Kojima|Kojima]], and Kojima leaves [[Konami]], because ''[[Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain|Metal Gear]]''. I have decided, in order not to destroy anyone else’s life, I have decided I will never again get involved in video games. Otherwise, I’ll join someone and his house will explode, or something.{{cite web|url=http://www.shacknews.com/article/90801/guillermo-del-toro-will-never-again-get-involved-in-video-games |title=Guillermo Del Toro 'will never again get involved in video games' |last=Perez |first=Daniel |work=[[Shacknews]] |publisher=Gamerhub |date=August 13, 2015 |accessdate=August 14, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150814210400/http://www.shacknews.com/article/90801/guillermo-del-toro-will-never-again-get-involved-in-video-games |archivedate=August 14, 2015 }}
=== ''Fantastic Voyage'' === On January 7, 2016, it was revealed that del Toro is attached to direct a remake of [[Richard Fleischer]]'s ''[[Fantastic Voyage]]'' for [[20th Century Fox]], along with the announcement that [[David S. Goyer]] and [[Justin Rhodes]] will be the writers and [[James Cameron]] will produce the film with his production company [[Lightstorm Entertainment]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/guillermo-del-toro-talks-direct-852592|title=Guillermo del Toro in Talks to Direct 'Fantastic Voyage' Remake (Exclusive)|publisher=hollywood reportee}} In August 2017, it was reported that del Toro had postponed working on the film to completely focus on his film ''[[The Shape of Water]]''.{{cite news|last1=Jr|first1=Mike Fleming|title=Guillermo Del Toro’s ‘Fantastic Voyage’ Pauses Until After Awards Season|url=http://deadline.com/2017/08/fantastic-voyage-guillermo-del-toro-postponed-the-shape-of-water-fox-1202156419/|accessdate=August 26, 2017|work=Deadline|date=August 25, 2017}} == References == {{reflist}} {{Guillermo del Toro}} [[Category:Lists of unrealized projects by artist|Toro, Guillermo del]] [[Category:Works by Guillermo del Toro]]

{{Infobox film | name = Hibiscus Town | image = Furongzhenposter.jpg | caption = Film poster | director = [[Xie Jin]] | producer = | writer = [[Ah Cheng]]
[[Xie Jin]] | based on = {{Based on|''Hibiscus Town''|[[Gu Hua]]}} | starring = [[Jiang Wen]]
[[Liu Xiaoqing]] | music = [[Ge Yan]] | cinematography = Lu Junfu | editing = | distributor = | studio = [[Shanghai Film Studio]] | country = China | released = {{Film date|1986}} | runtime = 164 minutes | language = Mandarin | budget = | film name = {{Film name| jianti = 芙蓉镇 | fanti = 芙蓉鎮 | pinyin = Fúróng zhèn}} }} '''''Hibiscus Town''''' ({{zh|t=芙蓉鎮|s=芙蓉镇|p=Fúróng zhèn|}}) is a 1986 Chinese film directed by [[Xie Jin]], based on a novel by the same name written by [[Gu Hua]]. The film, a [[melodrama]], follows the life and travails of a young woman who lives through the turmoil of the [[Cultural Revolution]] and as such is an example of the "scar drama" genre that emerged in the 1980s and 1990s that detailed life during that period. The film was produced by the [[Shanghai Film Studio]]. The film won Best Film for 1987 [[Golden Rooster Awards]] and [[Hundred Flowers Awards]], as well as Best Actress awards for [[Liu Xiaoqing]] at both ceremonies. It was also selected as the Chinese entry for the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[60th Academy Awards]], but was not accepted as a nominee.Margaret Herrick Library, Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences The village in [[Hunan]] province where the film was made, was initially known as Wang Village ({{lang|zh|王村}}; [[pinyin]]: ''Wáng cūn''). In 2007, the village was renamed Furong zhen ({{lang|zh|芙蓉镇}}) owing to this film.{{zh}} http://you.ctrip.com/sight/xiangxi496/17371.html ==Cast== * [[Liu Xiaoqing]] as Hu Yuyin, the film's heroine, a young woman who is caught up in the political turmoil of China's [[Cultural Revolution]]. She originally sells rice [[beancurd]] with her husband. * [[Liu Linian]] as Li Guigui, Yuyin's first husband * [[Jiang Wen]] as Qin Shutian, a "bourgeoisie" rightist who falls in love with Yuyin * [[Zheng Zaishi]] as Gu Yanshan, the granary director * [[Zhu Shibin]] as Wang Qiushe * [[Xu Songzi]] as Li Guoxiang * [[Zhang Guangbei]] as Li Mangeng ==Plot== The film follows Hu Yuyin (Liu Xiaoqing), a young and hardworking woman in a small Chinese town on the eve of the [[Cultural Revolution]]. She is happily married and runs a successful roadside food stall selling spicy [[beancurd]]. Yuyin is supported by Party members Li Mangeng (Zhang Guangbei), who once wanted to marry her, and Director Gu (Zheng Zaishi), a war veteran in charge of the granary. But in 1964 the [[Four Cleanups Movement]] sends a Party work-team to root out Rightists and [[capitalist roader]]s. The team is led by Li Guoxiang (Xu Songzi), a single woman, assisted by Wang Qiushe (Zhu Shibin), a former poor peasant who has lost his land because of his drinking. At a public [[struggle session]], Yuyin is declared to be a "new rich peasant." Both her home and business are taken from her and her husband, Li Guigui (Liu Linian) is executed for trying to kill Li Guoxiang. After the first waves of the Revolution have ended, Yuyin, now relegated to a lowly street sweeper, returns to the town. She then falls in love with Qin Shutian ([[Jiang Wen]]), who had come in the 1950s to collect local folksongs but was declared to be one of the [[Five Black Categories]]. When Yuyin becomes pregnant, however, this loving relationship attracts the outrage of Li Guoxiang and Wang Qiushe, who themselves are having a secret affair. Shutian is sent to [[reform through labor]] and it is not until [[Deng Xiaoping]]'s reforms in 1978 that his case is reviewed and he is allowed to return and help Yuyin re-establish their food stall. At the end of the film, Li Guoxiang continues to hold a position in the bureaucracy while Wang Qiushe loses his mind. ==Reception== The film was very well received domestically and was voted by Chinese film audiences as one of the three best films of 1987. It remains however quite obscure outside China. [[Gilbert Adair]] of ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]]'' magazine gave the film his endorsement, calling it "a potent blend of the political and personal": :"Xie's portrait of China's traumatic, turbulent history ranges from '63 to the post-'[[Gang of Four]]' years, his palette the changing fortunes of an entangled group of individuals. It's impressive both for the elegant precision with which the director fills his scope frame with small, significant details, and for the discreet understatement that controls his own special brand of epic melodrama. In some ways similar to the classic romances of [[Frank Borzage]], ''Hibiscus Town'' is a moving account of survival in the face of widespread social and political madness, told with clarity, compassion and insight."http://www.timeout.com/london/film/hibiscus-town. Retrieved on March 20, 2015. ==Awards== * '''[[Golden Rooster Awards]]''', [[1987 in film|1987]] ** Best Film ** Best Actress — [[Liu Xiaoqing]] ** Best Supporting Actress — [[Xu Songzi (actress)|Xu Songzi]] ** Best Art Direction— Jin Qifen * '''[[Hundred Flowers Awards]]''', [[1987 in film|1987]] ** Best Film — tied with ''[[Dr. Sun Yat-sen (film)|Dr. Sun Yat-sen]]'' and ''Xue zhan Taierzhuang'' ** Best Actor — [[Jiang Wen]] ** Best Actress — [[Liu Xiaoqing]] ** Best Supporting Actor — [[Zhu Shibin]] * '''[[Karlovy Vary International Film Festival]]''', [[1988 in film|1988]] ** [[Crystal Globe]], Grand Prix{{cite book|last=Marion|first=Donald J.|title=The Chinese Filmography|year=1997|publisher=McFarland|location=Jefferson, NC|isbn=0786403055|pages=265–266}} == See also == * [[Cultural Revolution]] - background of the film * [[List of submissions to the 60th Academy Awards for Best Foreign Language Film]] * [[List of Chinese submissions for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] == Further reading == * Browne, Nick. "Society and Subjectivity: On the Political Economy of Chinese Melodrama," in ''New Chinese Cinemas: Forms, Identities, Politics''. Cambridge: CUP, 1994, 57-87. * Hayford, Charles W. "Hibiscus Town: Revolution, Love and Bean Curd." In Chris Berry, ed., ''Chinese Films in Focus: 25 New Takes''. London: BFI Publishing, 2003, 120-27. * Kipnis, Andrew. "Anti-Maoist Gender: Hibiscus Town's Naturalization of a Dengist Sex/Gender/Kinship System." ''Asian Cinema'' 8, 2 (Winter 1996-97): 66-75. == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=0087301}} * {{AllMovie title|id=176203}} * [http://www.china.org.cn/english/features/film/85141.htm ''Hibiscus Town''] article from China.org * [http://www.dianying.com/en/title/frz1986 ''Hibiscus Town''] from the Chinese Movie Database * [https://web.archive.org/web/20071027032720/http://people.cohums.ohio-state.edu/denton2/courses/c505/temp/hibiscustown.html Overview and questions] of ''Hibiscus Town'' from [[Ohio State University]] {{Crystal Globe}} {{Golden Rooster Award for Best Picture}} [[Category:1986 films]] [[Category:1980s drama films]] [[Category:Chinese films]] [[Category:Mandarin-language films]] [[Category:Golden Rooster Best Film recipients]] [[Category:Films directed by Xie Jin]] [[Category:Films about the Cultural Revolution]] [[Category:Films based on Chinese novels]] [[Category:Crystal Globe winners]] [[Category:Pregnancy films]] [[Category:Shanghai Film Studio films]] [[Category:Screenplays by Ah Cheng]] {{Xie Jin}}

revision.comment: /* Indigenous Futurists */ added Celu Amberstone (new article)
revision.text:
'''Indigenous Futurisms''' is a movement consisting of art, literature, comics, games, and other forms of media which express Indigenous perspectives of the future, past, and present in the context of science fiction and related sub-genres. Such perspectives may reflect Indigenous ways of knowing, traditional stories, historical or contemporary politics or other cultural realities.
Like [[Afrofuturism]], Indigenous futurism encapsulates multiple modes of art making from literature to visual arts, fashion and music.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Guzmán|first1=Alicia Inez|title=Indigenous Futurisms|url=https://ivc.lib.rochester.edu/indigenous-futurisms/|website=InVisible Culture: An Electronic Journal for Visual Culture|publisher=University of Rochester|accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> The term was coined by Grace Dillon,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gaertner|first1=David|title=“WHAT’S A STORY LIKE YOU DOING IN A PLACE LIKE THIS?”: CYBERSPACE AND INDIGENOUS FUTURISM|url=https://novelalliances.com/2015/03/23/whats-a-story-like-you-doing-in-a-place-like-this-cyberspace-and-indigenous-futurism-in-neal-stephensons-snow-crash/#_ftn1|website=Novel Alliances: Allied Perspectives on Literature, Art and New Media}}</ref> Professor in the Indigenous Nations Studies Program at Portland State University.<ref>{{cite web|title=Grace Dillon|url=https://www.pdx.edu/nas/grace-l-dillon-2|website=Portland State University|accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> Indigenous Futurisms critiques the historization of Indigenous people which is used to separate from them the contemporary world while challenging notions of what constitutes advanced technology <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://thenewinquiry.com/the-space-ndns-star-map/|title=The Space NDN’s Star Map|last=Cornum|first=Lou Catherine|date=January 26, 2015|website=The New Inquiry|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
Prominent artists working within the field of Indigenous futurism include [[Skawennati]], a Mohawk multi-media artist best known for her project ''TimeTraveller™'', a nine-episode [[machinima]] series that uses science fiction to examine First nations histories,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ore|first1=Jonathan|title=Machinima art series revisits Oka Crisis, moments in native history|url=http://www.cbc.ca/newsblogs/arts/the-buzz/2013/10/machinima-art-series-revisits-oka-crisis-moments-in-native-history.html|website=Cbc News|accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> Grace Dillon, who is editor of ''Walking the Clouds: An Anthology of Indigenous Science Fiction'',<ref>{{cite book|last1=Dillon|first1=Grace L.|title=Walking the Clouds: An Anthology of Indigenous Science Fiction|publisher=The University of Arizona Press|isbn=978-0-8165-2982-7}}</ref> [[Stephen Graham Jones]], a Blackfeet Native American author, and [[Wendy Red Star]], a Native American contemporary multimedia artist.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Nixon|first1=Lindsay|title=Visual Cultures of Indigenous Futurisms|url=http://gutsmagazine.ca/visual-cultures/|website=Guts Magazine|accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> Additionally, Lou Catherine Cornum is a writer and scholar currently working in the field of Indigenous futurism.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Cornum|first1=Lindsey Catherine|title=Indigenous Futurism and Decolonial Deep Space|url=http://www.vozavoz.ca/feature/lindsay-catherine-cornum|website=VOZ-À-VOZ|publisher=e-fagia organization|accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref>
== Indigenous Futurists == * [[A Tribe Called Red]], musicians * [[Celu Amberstone]], Cherokee writer * [[Roy Boney, Jr.]], Cherokee animator, illustrator, comic artist, painter * [[Todd Tamanend Clark]], Onodowaga/Lenape poet and composer * [[Jeffrey Gibson]], Choctaw/Cherokee painter and sculptor * [[Cheryl l'Hirondelle]], Métis-descent multimedia artist * [[Elizabeth LaPensée]], Anishinaabe, Métis, and Irish game designer * [[Peter Morin]], Tahltan performance artist * [[Stephen Graham Jones]], Blackfeet author * [[Jamie Okuma]], Luiseño/Shoshone-Bannock beadwork artist and fashion designer * [[Virgil Ortiz]], Cochiti ceramic sculptor and designer * [[Wendy Ponca]], Osage fashion designer * [[Rebecca Roanhorse]], Ohkay Owingeh Pueblo writer * [[Skawennati]], Mohawk multimedia artist * [[Jackson 2bears]], Kanien’kehaka (Mohawk) multimedia installation/performance artist and cultural theorist
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
== See also == * [[CyberPowWow]] * [[Indigenous people in video gaming]] * [[Never Alone (video game)|Never Alone]] * [[Thunderbird Strike]]
==Further reading and multimedia== *Dillon, Grace L. ''Indigenous Futurisms'' [https://www.pdx.edu/nas/sites/www.pdx.edu.nas/files/NAS%20401%20Indigenous%20Futurisms%20description%20S%202015.pdf], (pdf) *Roanhorse, Rebecca, Elizabeth LaPensée, Johnnie Jae, and Darcie Little Badger. “Decolonizing Science Fiction and Imagining Futures: An Indigenous Futurisms Roundtable.” ''Strange Horizons'' (Jan. 2017). [http://strangehorizons.com/non-fiction/articles/decolonizing-science-fiction-and-imagining-futures-an-indigenous-futurisms-roundtable/] *LaPensée, Elizabeth. “Animating Indigenous Scientific Literacies.” ''Labocine'' (Jan. 2017). [http://labocine.com/spotlight/47] *"Indigenous Futurisms," ''InVisible Culture: An Electronic Journal for Visual Culture'', Alicia Inez Guzmán, March 15, 2015. [https://ivc.lib.rochester.edu/indigenous-futurisms/] *"Indigenous Futurisms Mixtape," ''RPMfm'' [https://soundcloud.com/rpmfm/indigenous-futurisms-mixtape]

revision.text:
The '''International Federation of Landscape Architects''' ('''IFLA''') is an organisation which represents the [[landscape architecture|landscape architectural]] profession globally. It aims to provide leadership and networks to support the development of the profession and its effective participation in the realization of attractive, equitable and sustainable environments. IFLA currently represents 76 member associations from Africa, the Americas, Europe and Asia Pacific, and a newly emerging region in the Middle East. The Federation's mission is to create globally sustainable and balanced living environments for the benefit of humanity worldwide.
Through its Member Associations, IFLA officially represents approximately 25,000 landscape architects across the world – the actual number of landscape architects is estimated to be about three times that.
IFLA has 11 aims: # To increase respect for the profession through the high esteem in which the Federation is held by international and regional organisations including various United Nations Agencies. # To provide access to decision-making authorities and processes at international level that have global implications for landscape architecture # To represent and promote the profession to international authorities, governments, NGO’s and the general public. # To provide a platform for the exchange of knowledge and expertise. # To offer powerful institutional support to fight legislative threats to the integrity of the profession. # To provide a global platform for educational and professional opportunities. # To serve as a repository of information concerning landscape architecture, its heritage and capacities. # To grant access to projects which provide value to landscape architects at every stage of their career such as the Global Professional Standards Survey, Student Design Competition, Sir Geoffrey Jellicoe Award. # To raise the profile of the profession worldwide by supporting the development of new member associations and regions. # To provide access to international thought leaders demonstrating the capacity of landscape to meet global challenges such as water and food security, climate change, conflict, migration and depletion of natural resources. # To provide a global platform for engaging landscape architects (and those from related industries) in improving the conditions, aims and context of the profession long-term. The governing body of IFLA is its World Council which comprises officers of the Executive Committee and the duly appointed delegates of the member associations which have been admitted to IFLA as members.
The [http://iflaonline.org/about/structure-governance/executive-committee/ IFLA Executive Committee] develops and implements an action plan which realises three key strategic pillars of i) raising the profile of the profession; ii) building advocacy and; iii) providing member services that serve anyone connected to landscape architecture. IFLA's work is primarily delivered through projects, a matrix of working groups and collaboration with national, regional and international partners.
==History== IFLA was founded at [[Cambridge]], [[England]], in 1948 with [[Geoffrey Jellicoe|Sir Geoffrey Jellicoe]] as its first president, representing 15 countries from [[Europe]] and North America. Later, in 1978, IFLA's Headquarters were established in [[Versailles (city)|Versailles]].<ref name=IFLAbook>IFLA Past, Present, Future - A publication about the history of IFLA. {{ISBN|3-9522080-0-0}}</ref><ref>[http://unesdoc.unesco.org/Ulis/cgi-bin/ulis.pl?catno=123501&set=48C9DF56_2_0&gp=0&lin=1 UNCESCO Documents and Publications]</ref> Presently IFLA's Headquarters are in Brussels.
==Presidents==

== Notes == <references/> 1. Speech of Diane Menzies, on the celebration of FCC centenary, available at http://proffranciscocaldeiracabral.portaldojardim.com/depoimentos/depoimento-dr-diane-menzies/, accessed on 27/06/2015 {{Authority control}}

[[File:Jean-Pierre Ponnelle Strasbourg 1980.jpg|thumb|right|Jean-Pierre Ponnelle]] '''Jean-Pierre Ponnelle''' (19 February 1932 – 11 August 1988) was a French opera [[Theatre director|director]], [[scenographer]] and [[costume designer]].
==Biography== Ponnelle was born in Paris. He studied philosophy, art, and history there and, in 1952, began his career in Germany as a theatre designer for [[Hans Werner Henze]]'s opera ''[[Boulevard Solitude]]''. He was greatly influenced by the work of art director [[Georges Wakhévitch]] who also designed sets and costumes for the theatre, the ballet, and the opera.
In 1962, Ponnelle directed his first production of [[Richard Wagner]]'s ''[[Tristan und Isolde]]'' in [[Düsseldorf]]. His production of that opera at the [[Bayreuth Festival]] in 1981 was widely praised as one of the most aesthetically beautiful in its history.
His work throughout the world included stage productions at the [[Metropolitan Opera]] and the [[San Francisco Opera]]; productions for television (a ''[[Madama Butterfly]]'' in 1974 notable for performances by [[Mirella Freni]] and the young [[Plácido Domingo]]); and filmed versions of operas such as the well-known [[Karl Böhm]]-conducted ''[[The Marriage of Figaro]]''. His 1969 production of [[Mozart]]'s then neglected ''[[La Clemenza di Tito]]'' for [[Cologne]] helped re-establish this work in the repertory. Ponnelle also was a frequent guest at the [[Salzburg Festival]].<ref>[http://www.salzburgerfestspiele.at/dieinstitution/geschichte/ Salzbug Festival website (in English)] Retrieved 3 January 2009</ref>
Often, his productions were controversial. His 1986 ''[[Aida]]'' at [[Covent Garden]], in which he replaced the usual ballet dancers with young boys, was soundly booed and never revived, though his earlier ''[[Don Pasquale]]'' at the same theatre had been a triumph,<ref>Pfaff, ''San Francisco Chronicle'': "Welcome as it may be to find Jean-Pierre Ponnelle's infamous 1975 Eurotrash production of the work, presented as "The Steersman's Dream", (which held the War Memorial stage for three of the company's five presentations of the piece) banished, presumably forever, it can still be a strain to discern ''Dutchman''.</ref> as were his interpretations of well-known works. <ref>Porter, Andrew, ''The Times'': "Only in recent years have directors taken it upon themselves to rewrite Wagner's stage actions, to intervene, to move from simplification to new invention. Jean-Pierre Ponnelle's idea at Bayreuth, in 1981, was that Isolde should not appear in Act Three but be an off-stage voice sounding in Tristan's mind"</ref><ref>Chatfield-Taylor, p. 63: "Some critics felt that there was...perversity in Ponnelle's conception of ''(Rigoletto)'' as a flashback that begins with Gilda already dead, lying on the floor during the Prelude".</ref>
He died in [[Munich]], Germany in 1988 of a [[pulmonary embolism]] following a tragic fall into the orchestra pit during rehearsals for a production of ''Carmen'' with the [[Israel Philharmonic Orchestra]] under [[Zubin Mehta]]. His son is the orchestra conductor [[Pierre-Dominique Ponnelle]] and his nephew is [[Jean Pierre Danel]].

{{multiple issues| {{Notability|Companies|date=July 2015}} {{Third-party|date=July 2015}} {{Cleanup|reason=excessive capitalisation and enboldening needs removing|date=July 2015}} {{Orphan|date=June 2016}} }} {{Infobox company | name = KWANPEN | logo = File:KWANPEN_LOGO.jpeg | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | logo_padding = | image = | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = | trading_name = | traded_as = | ISIN = | industry = Luxury bags and leather goods | founded = [[Singapore]] (1938) | founder = Kwan Pen Seng | hq_location = KWANPEN Building, Singapore | coordinates = | area_served = Asia, Europe | key_people = Leonard Kwan (President) | products = Handbags, Small leather Goods, Shoes | website = www.kwanpen.com }}
'''KWANPEN''' is a [[Singapore]]-based manufacturer and retailer specializing in [[crocodile]] [[leather]] goods.
==History== The company was founded by Kwan Pen Seng in 1938.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sg.news.yahoo.com/singapore-brand-carves-niche-luxury-market-20110417-153809-448.html |title=Singapore brand carves niche in luxury market - Yahoo News Singapore |publisher=Sg.news.yahoo.com |date=2011-04-18 |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref> He started out in the leatherworking industry by offering restoration services for leather handbags owned by the wives of British officers and businessmen.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lin |first=Andrea |url=http://is.asia-city.com/city-living/article/made-singapore |title=Made in Singapore | SG Magazine Online |publisher=Is.asia-city.com |date=2009-08-06 |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref> This led the founder to start his trade in manufacturing crocodile leather bags from his home-based workshop. Kwanpen gradually expanded in mid-1970s to include contract work from top Western labels and the first Kwanpen retail shop opened on [[Orchard Road]] in 1976. In 1980, Mr Leonard Kwan, current president of the company, took over the business from his father and the brand’s logo, inspired by the family’s first name, was created in 1989. The first Kwanpen overseas retail outlet was opened in [[Hong Kong]] in 1999. Since then, Kwanpen has expanded its reach internationally to countries such as the [[United Kingdom]], [[South Korea]] and [[Hong Kong]] and also operate at department store standalone counters in [[Bangkok]], [[Seoul]] and [[Busan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwanpen.com/boutiques/ |title=Boutiques |publisher=Kwanpen |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.getsingapore.sg/brands/kwanpen/locations/ |title=GET SINGAPORE - KWANPEN - Bags of quality and craftsmanship |publisher=Getsingapore.sg |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref>
==Products== All Kwanpen bags are still manufactured in Singapore using the center belly-cut crocodile leather where most of the manufacturing is done manually.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwanpen.com/kwanpen/handmade/ |title=Handmade |publisher=Kwanpen |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref>
The main collections in the Kwanpen lineup are the ''Raffles'', ''Droplet'', ''Signature'' and ''Classic'' collections.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwanpen.com/category/women/handbags/ |title=Women's Handbags |publisher=Kwanpen |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref> Their ''Raffles'' handbag was launched in 1991,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwanpen.com/showcase_item/3568-raffles-1819/?stayincat=11 |title=Raffles 1819 Handbag |publisher=Kwanpen |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref> and the oldest design still in production is the Lady’s ''Classic'' handbag first created in 1983.
===Conservation=== The company, who has been a member of the [[International Union for Conservation of Nature]] and Natural Resources/ Crocodile Specialist Group since 1985, only buys crocodile skin that comes with certification from [[CITES]]. All goods produced and exported by Kwanpen are accompanied with this certification.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globalblue.com/destinations/singapore/kwanpen-singapore/ |title=Kwanpen Singapore |publisher=Global Blue |date= |accessdate=2015-07-18}}</ref>
==Milestones== {{Prose|section|date=July 2015}} *1976: Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Singapore]] on [[Orchard Road]], selling crocodile leather bags. *1989: First Kwanpen Logo *1991: Launch of Kwanpen ''Raffles'' Handbag *1996: Opened first overseas Kwanpen Store in [[The Peninsula Hong Kong|Peninsula Hotel]], [[Hong Kong]] *2000: Launch of Kwanpen ''Signature'' Collection *2002: Launch of Kwanpen ''Droplet'' Collection, Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Thailand]] at [[Gaysorn]], [[Bangkok]] *2005: Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Malaysia]] at Starhill, [[Kuala Lumpur]] *2008: Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Macau]] at [[Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts|Four Seasons]] Venetian *2011: Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[South Korea]] at Chung-Dam Dong, [[Seoul]], Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Turkey]] at [[Nişantaşı]], [[Istanbul]] *2012: Opened first Kwanpen Store in [[Qatar]] at [[The Pearl-Qatar]], [[Doha]] *2015: Opened first Kwanpen Store in the [[United Kingdom]] at [[Burlington Arcade]], [[London]]
